title: A Confession:
body:
I get very smug satisfaction from voting "no" to a surrender vote that a raging/flaming teammate starts.  It's even better when your teammates join your passive-aggression and it fails 1/4.  It's always followed by:  "GUYS WE HAVE NO CHANCE OF WINNING"  "SURRENDER NOW OR I AFK!!!!!!!!!!"

We may be losing, but, hey, we still have a chance to piss off this salty guy!  :D

replies.body: It draws more ammo for the post-game report I was going to file anyway.
Oh god letting them twist in the wind and they just deposit enough salt to make a geological formation. Makes me so happy that I know they are going to get some kind of punishment.
YES! I thought I was the only one.

Lol, nice try with the "I can't tell" or "I don't know" defense. You know exactly who I'm talking to. Because you're the kind of toxic player that no one wants to play with. Whether that player is "raging" or not, when it's pretty clear that you're team has no chance of coming back and are put into those Impossible Decision situations, then it's better to surrender and not waste another 10 - 20 minutes trying to "come back" when you could clearly just surrender and go on to the next game, where you may have a better chance at winning.

It doesn't take much for anyone to figure this out. Even my cat's turds could tell you that. It really is quite sad that you have near to a hundred other trolls backing you. But I'm really grinning from ear to ear, just laughing my ass off, because with 2.4k views on this thread and climbing, you're just ousting yourself from the rest of the community (excluding the other trolls backing you). Anyone who has common courtesy and common sense will know that you are in the wrong for doing this just as much as the other guy "raging" and will be putting you on their ignore lists. Not that the reason the other guy is raging is wrong, but he could be handling it better.

Either way, your "confession" is an idiotic one. You're pretty lucky that Riot doesn't check the Boards as often as they should. Otherwise, this thread would be taken down and you'd be penalized. Of course, Riot is just as much of a dick as you are. Well, most of Riot. But you get my point.
Yeah, that was my bad.  I honestly didn't know because I didn't realize you could change the board layout to "discussion."  Of course, I know now that you replied to my original post.
Uh huh. And would you care to show me how to "change" the "board layout"? Because from what I can tell, it's always in discussion mode.

Look, I made a mistake and I'm admitting it.  I'm not trying to continue evading being called an asshole, I'm just explaining what happened, and that I was legitimately confused.  You can change it with the "switch to chronological view" near the top of the page, right under the "Discuss" and right on top of the "Leave a Comment" box.

Actually, a friend of mine did just this. They were down 3 inhibs and 4 dragons, 40 kills on the enemy team to his team's 15 kills. The enemy was on their nexus (no nexus towers even) and he got a Pentakill with Ziggs and immediately beat the enemy team by rushing down their base while the enemy was still dead. Every game is winnable.

Fact is, you always hear the one-in-a-million story of a team coming back from this, and not all the rest of the stories where it doesn't happen.

Yes 2 or 3 inhibs down. I am not sure about the dragon. Still that kind of attitude "we can't win this" is what will loose you a game.

Also I automatically don't surrender. There are ofcourse exceptions when I do not have strenght to listen to my flaming team mates, but thats rarely a case.
this is a good point where silencing team mates will make winning so much easier. i have friends who silence at the start of games. raises them to higher tier as they avoid the squabble at my elo.

I do not like to cut off people from the beginning so I wait until they start to spam/flame and then mute them.

Also I mute people after I do some big mistake.To aviod reading any insulting meassages.

As main support I would really reccomend to mute player that you are stuck with in lane. It makes things easier. Though I sometimes unmute people when I think they have no resont to flame.

I'm suuuure you have. Or perhaps you're just lucky that you get 3-4 good teammates instead of four shitty ones. While I may have been in some games similar to what you described, I will tell you this. The only reason I didn't bring up the surrender vote a second time was because I saw my team stepping up some. And that situation has been very rare to me. Because there's not a whole lot of people I can trust playing this game. I can't expect four randoms to just make a comeback when we're already far behind the other team. I've been with so many bad players that I've just become cynical and I'm glad that I am too, because I don't want to set myself up for disappointment by being the "happy cheery" guy that says "Come on! We can win!" and we still end up losing.

But you're not nearly as much of an asshole that SulkingRaccoon is.
I would not describe myself as "happy cheery" Guy. I just play until The end.

So prideful then? Or are you just that bored? Either way, if you know the game isn't going to end in your team's favor, it's best not to waste their time and let them embarrass themselves further. Again, just now, got out of nemesis draft, had a failed surrender, but I kept playing because my team was finding a way to come back, and more so since the enemy made a big mistake. So yeah, we could have surrendered, but we found a window of opportunity. And in a lot of games I've played, when it hits the 20 minute mark, that window is gone. Closed shut.

>  if you know the game isn't going to end in your team's favor

Thing is you never know. THats why I do not surrender.

Also I do not consider loosing game a waste of time. You can still learn a lot from these games.
And I highly dissagree with your 20 minute window.

Yes there are games that are or seem decided by 20 min mark. But until you have lost few teamfights all dragons and you are peramanently terorized in jungle, that game is far from lost.
And all that cannot happen in 20 minutes.

20 minutes can be just laning phase that will hardly decide anything.

I would lose 95% of my games if we surrendered whenever someone threw out a vote.
Have won 4v5s, have won 3v5s. 
People still don't understand that the Comcast Gambit is a viable strategy at all times.
NEVER SURRENDER.

I'm split on this. 
On one hand, there are many games you can turn around if you all push together and focus.
On the other hand, those same turnabouts usually take 15+ minutes to bring around, and then there's still the chance to lose.

Dedication to a match is cool and all, but staring at grayscale Summoner's Rift while the enemy Jinx laughs at your corpse is not my number one way to spend twenty minutes.

It is one thing to refuse to surrender if, afterward, you try to be positive, point out ways to make a comeback, and generally try to achieve victory.

It is another thing entirely to refuse to surrender just to punish someone who is raging.  You're punishing everyone who voted yes, subjecting them to more of that person's vitriol, and extending a generally painful match.  Oftentimes, when I've seen someone like the OP in my games, they refuse to surrender and then do nothing but farm at a turret, often pausing to poke and prod the rager into raging even more.  That's not constructive, and makes them every bit the troll they are punishing.

In most cases, I don't think a chance of losing is a good reason to end a game.  There are a lot of times where I have fun even in a losing game (of course this doesn't always happen), and, playing these games out gives you the practice you need in playing a game from behind, which helps you turn other games around.  Even if you still lose, the knowledge is very valuable and you have more time to think about how to improve a situation.

I vowed myself that I will never surrender after a game I did in Normals. I was Zilean, every lane in our team lost, they were at our nexus turrets fairly early game, and our Sion decided to troll rather than help. Eventually, I decided to have fun, after all it is a normal, its suppose to be for fun :D We were soloing baron, dancing in front of the enemy team's fountain, in the end, we won. We distracted the enemy team so much, that my friend, Zed, started to pick them off one by one. Not to mention in the final teamfight, I was spamming in /ALL "Cant Killean the Zilean" irraitating them to focus me while I have my ult :P Several Surrender Votes by our team of course, but never give up and have fun. http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/1718935038/39853717?tab=overview

I won't surrender if the one starting it is the Flamer/Feeder/Rager that caused us to lose in the first place. When i say feed i mean the 0-8 Singed top who kept complaining about Quinn and kept dying under her turret with nothing but mana items, then blaming it on something other than his own stupidity. If the one surrendering is one of the guys on our team doing well then i'll usually say yes (assuming he's not a jerk) because i don't want to cause someone to start raging or go on tilt if they're being decent.

It is people like you that make bronze the awful place it is and you probably aren't surrendering when you're down two inhibs 4 drags a baron and 20 kills, then you create this toxic person who doesn't know how to quit and carries over their anger to the next 5. So please uninstall
you could do that, or you could just jump into the next game because really who cares if you make a ragey random person in the internet a bit more miserable ?

In ARAM I'm surprised, even annoyed sometimes when people start surrendering. Sort of a 'why do you care that much?!?!? Its ARAM!' feeling. Yeah some matchups are just pointless for one team, but you can always find a way to have fun in that mode. 

In normals I get the same sense as you because being salty is usually the only reason for anyone starting the vote anyway, so I tend to enjoy voting no. But I'll vote yes when team fights are so one sided its not even fun to lose, AND the other team is in our base. You can safely call the game over at that point.

My friends and I have a similar outlook on ARAMs, but it's getting harder every time. After struggling against, and inevitably losing to, the same Katarina and Ziggs comps several times in a row, I'm starting to think that most people don't take ARAM as lightly as they should.

Yeah, I've had my fair share of terrible ARAMs, but oddly enough its my own team that tends to frustrate me more, and I know thats stupid since theres always a good chance they barely know the champ. 

In either case, when it all goes wrong doing nonsense stuff can lighten your mood. Ultimate Bravery is good fun with friends, but even just trying a stupid build because of some synergy or oddly high AP scaling (Rammus, Hec) can be entertaining. When you can't beat the matchup, it seems to make it less frustrating when your build ain't beating anything anyway, and any minor success becomes much more gratifying.
What gets me is that if he afks and you lose, it's still the same result... not like he's really threatening anything.

haters are gonna hate

This type of behavior just lowers you to their level. In my opinion you look worse honestly. You are essentially willing to actively and consciously expend energy to aggravate and provoke another person when the alternative action would be to simply walk away and move on with your life. This is a form of bullying. The person who is raging at the team and wants to surrender may be a jerk but has surrendered to their own weakness for anger. You made a conscious decision for revenge essentially. This is shallow. 

Furthermore this type of behavior only continues to provoke more negative behavior. If you have ever wanted the community to be move positive but act in such a manner then you have no right to complain as you are actively contributing to the negative atmosphere. People want everyone else to change but take no personal responsibility for their own actions. If you want change you have to understand that the negativity as to stop somewhere. Someone has to stand up and be the bigger person and say "No, I'm not going to respond, I'm not going to sink to their level, I'm not going to let them get under my skin and affect my behavior". That's what's really happening too, you are letting this person win, you are letting them affect your behavior and change how you would have acted without their presence. They won, they got under your skin, they provoked you to retaliation which is what every rager wants most even if it angers them more.

Your confession (which is an exceptionally accurate term as a confession involves something you should be ashamed of having done) is not unique and I believe is a very common sentiment among a large part of the LOL community. That does not make it acceptable. It shows your own weakness and lack of emotional restraint and strength. Learn to be more self controlled, have more self respect, don't let these people change who you are. And if you can't do that, please just use the mute button.

I do realize that I came across as sounding very malicious in my original post.  I somewhat regret that.  I'm not necessarily trying to bully the person who is raging, I simply don't want to give in to the ending that they want.  I don't think anyone is obligated to vote "yes."

All I am doing here is pressing the "no" button.  Whether or not you think that is bullying, I just wanted to clear up any misunderstanding.  I'm certainly not replying in chat to these ragers, insulting them in writing, or doing anything of that sort.
I would understand this from an unranked players, but if it is ranked it is better to just play another game.

Yeah, that makes sense, because I haven't played ranked in a while now.  But I was under the impression that a lot of ranked players were hesitant to start a surrender vote because of the guaranteed loss of lp.
A troll, rager, flamer, salty, whatever is a guaranteed loss of IP, it is better to just play another game and avoid players like that.

Sometimes, I like to ping a brush and tell my teammates its warded, even though I know it's not. Then I get to see them waste their sweeper on it and look around confused.

Bonus points if its the Jungler with Raptor Buff :3

I apologize publicly for my actions.
If you are legitamitly saying no because you think you can win then that's fine but if you are doing it just to piss off another player then you are just being an asshole
